task.title: Showing revisions
task.shortdesc: You can show the revision information for your content. All revision information is hidden by default.

substep.cmd: Open the directory you want to add the file to in Windows Explorer.
Right-click and select New DITA Filter File.
Give the file a descriptive name, like revs1-3-build.ditaval.

step.cmd: Define the revision you want to show:

substep.cmd: Type the name of the revision you want to show.
Provide the date of the revision, or the date it started or ended.
Define how the revision will be flagged in XHTML: either with color, or with images.
substep.info: Generally you should use images rather than color to ensure that your output is flagged consistently and accessibly. Color only works for flagging phrase-level information, and may not be distinguishable to color-blind readers, on monochrome displays, or once an online page is printed.

substep.cmd: Define what character to use when flagging the revision in PDF.
substep.info: The character will be used in a revision bar in the margin of the page next to the revised content.

step.info: You need to define a separate property for each revision you want to show. For example, if you wanted to show three revisions, you would need to define each separately, including different colors and revision bar characters.

step.cmd: When you publish output for the topic or map, specify the filter file you want to use on the Transform page of the output options.
